content.description: Work the flakes and lie back through to pull yourself up into and under the roof. Work feet across the bulge and hands into the dish onto yang and finish the top out on the yang route
content.location: Farthest end of harmony wall before the cave underneath

content.description: Match holds at the jug at the bottom. Work through the half cracks and crimps up into the dish on the ride side and finish with the ledge on the top left side.
content.location: Next to yin. Yin intertwines into yang

content.description: Start on two large pockets, climb pockets to flat jug.
content.location: Located on right where cliff becomes less overhung.

content.description: Start on pockets just above small roof, climb straight up pockets to finish.
content.location: Located to the right of Object Permanence.

content.description: Start with low left hand side pull and high right hand pocket. Head up veering right and back left staying left of the seem to the right and right of any holds on the next problem to the left. Finish by getting established on the slab above. It's a bit of a contrived squeeze job, but the movement is ok.
content.location: The second problem on the wall just where it starts to get more overhung. Just left of Tread Water

content.description: Start left hand flat undercling right hand side pull crimp, make big move to dish and finish on jug.
content.location: Located just to the right of Capacity.

content.description: Work the pockets underneath the bulge to the left. Position yourself and move hard with left hand onto outside bulge and hold on hard. Move right hand up over the nose of the bulge into the double pocket at the top. Top out will be the horn above and to the left of the 2 digit pocket.
Start on two slots move to side pull and go big to dish, follow good holds to finish.
content.location: Located on the left side where the cliff gets less overhung.

content.description: Left handed sloper and right hand in crack to start and is probly the hardest part of the problem. Move up into the jugs and the top out is a small ledge right before the large face
content.location: Right below the small caves on the wall. Very noticeable

content.description: Start with the two opposing horns/flakes at the base underneath the bulge. Footwork is super important to get over the bulge. There is a crack that runs the right side up. Work the right hand through the cracks and use the double digit pocket to pull up to the left handed sloper. Pull through and top on the triangle shape rock at top.
content.location: About 150 feet from the main top roping wall. Stuck right in the sunlight can’t miss it

content.description: Start right hand jug and left hand crimp, move through sharp pockets to jug. Make a few more moves to finish.
content.location: Located in center of overhung section.

content.description: Toward the left side of the cliff there is a short overhung section of rock, this is where you will find the boulders. Not many climbs nor are they that good, but the rock is solid and there are a couple hard ones.
